summary: Add an event listener to globalThis (window/global)

ports.name: Active
ports.text: Enable or disable the event listener

ports.name: Event Name
ports.text: The name of the event to listen for (e.g. 'resize', 'scroll', 'mousedown', etc.)

ports.name: Use Capture
ports.text: Whether to use event capturing instead of bubbling

ports.name: Passive
ports.text: A boolean value that, if true, indicates that the function specified by listener will never call preventDefault(). If a passive listener does call preventDefault(), the user agent will do nothing other than generate a console warning.

ports.name: Prevent Default
ports.text: If set the default browser action for the event will not be executed.

ports.name: Stop Propagation
ports.text: Stops other elementsâ€™ event listeneres from getting called.

ports.name: Event Trigger
ports.text: Triggered when the event occurs on globalThis

ports.name: Event Object
ports.text: The event object containing details about the event
